newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algerian minister quits his party, stays in cabinet.
newsitem.headline: Algerian minister quits his party, stays in cabinet.

text.p: Algeria's Tourism Minister Abdelaziz Benmhidi said on Friday he had quit the moderate Islamist Algerian Renewal Party (PRA), the official Algerian news agency APS said.

He said his resignation was effective immediately, said APS without giving a reason. He remains in the cabinet, which he joined in 1996 in President Liamine Zeroual's drive to broaden the government's base.

Benmhidi was the PRA's member on the Consultative Council policy-making body since 1990 when the party was created. PRA is one of more than 30 political parties preparing for National Assembly elections on June 5.
